author: wsjcom
title: Politicians Make Housing Less Affordable
text:
Regarding Paul Kupiec and Edward Pinto’s “The High Cost of ‘Affordable Housing’ Mandates,” op-ed, Feb. 13): I am not a proponent of affordable housing having seen firsthand, as a development attorney, how mandates are used to hold up and extort small towns. The example used by Messrs. Kupiec and Pinto is fundamentally flawed. They fail to take into account that in exchange for building 10% affordable units within a development, the developer will receive a significant increase in the density allowed for market units to offset the cost of building the required affordable units.
